org.ggp.base.util.gdl

Class GdlValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ggp.base.util.gdl.GdlValidator

  • public final class GdlValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    The GdlValidator class implements Gdl validation for the GdlFactory class. Its purpose is to validate whether or not a Symbol can be transformed into a Gdl expression without error.

      GdlValidator()

      boolean validate(Symbol symbol)
      Validates whether a Symbol can be transformed into a Gdl expression without error using the following process: Returns true if the Symbol is a SymbolAtom.

      • GdlValidator

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(Symbol symbol)
        Validates whether a Symbol can be transformed into a Gdl expression without error using the following process:
        1. Returns true if the Symbol is a SymbolAtom. Otherwise, treats the Symbol as a SymbolList.
        2. Checks that the SymbolList contains no sub-elements that are SymbolLists which do not begin with a SymbolAtom.
        3. Checks that neither the SymbolList nor its sub-elements contain the deprecated 'or' keyword.
        Note that as implemented, this method is incomplete: it only verifies a subset of the correctness properties of well-formed Gdl. A more thorough implementation is advisable.
        Parameters:
        symbol - The Symbol to validate.
        Returns:
        True if the Symbol passes validation; false otherwise.
